bibl.title: Letter from Robert P. Cooke to Philip Showalter Hench, March 24, 1941

div1.p: Cooke complies with Hench's suggested alterations to his letter to Ramos. He thanks Hench for all the material Hench sent him concerning the Lazear Memorial celebration.

div1.head: Letter from Robert P. Cooke to Philip Showalter Hench, March 24, 1941
div1.opener:
COMMONWEALTH OF VIRGINIA
STATE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH
LEXINGTON-ROCKBRIDGE HEALTH DEPARTMENT
LEXINGTON, VIRGINIA
March 24th 1941
Dr Philip S. Hench
Rochester Minn.
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
Having made the changes you suggest
in my letter to Dr Ramos I am mailing
it to you today and hope it will arrive
in time to catch you in Florida.

Thank you so much for letting me
go over this material and that which
you previously sent relating to the Lazear
Memorial celebration. I greatly en-
joyed reading your address during
the latter Ceremonies- You have certainly
brought to light many hidden facts in your
memorialization, and especially in relation to Lazears
death. I think it highly probable your conclusions
as to that are factual
